comments.commentBody: That made me laugh. Thank you!
And what punishment for Trump burning our Constitution?

I can just hear him say to himself, when the pressure mounts....Change The Subject. So he casts about for something else, anything else. And makes a mountain out of whatever molehill he finds. Flag burning, re-counts, torture--whatever he needs to do to divert attention from the big and important issues. The barn burners, like conflict of interest, or all those unqualified appointments.
This is how his mind works--feverishly worked up all the time over minutiae. He can't let these things go. It is part of his peculiar sickness. It must be exhausting to be him, for it is certainly exhausting to listen to it all.

Yes,  watch wall to wall coverage of my outrageous flag comment, but pay no attention to the parade of interviewees and new cabinet members through my office,  pulled straight from the bilionaires and Wall Street insiders, the exact people I promised I would never nominate!
So on point u are

It's safe to say the most persons would rather not burn the flag or any other item, on the street or near their house.

And there are way bigger behavior problems around the village square than someone setting a flag on fire. Just take a walk down 5th avenue or any other avenue in New York, San Francisco or your local town.

We should demand that the president and the administration focus on issues that matter and problems that need solving, not flag burning.

You would think that a president-elect supposedly busy trying to populate a cabinet would not have time to bother with flag burners.  His suggestions for dealing with this existential threat to America are both unconstitutional and illegal.  This issue was settled by SCOTUS over 20 years ago.  Will Twitter PLEASE shut down this man-child's acccount.
Agreed whoeheartedly. Does this guy bother reading before spouting ignorant rhetoric?

Progress from flag burning to desecrating it by allowing it to touch the ground then for picking up road dust when placed on rear of redneck's pickup. Advance onto penalties for disrespecting it by not standing when it is passing in a parade in front of you and on and on. Biggest penalty administered when fail to salute it when the emperor enters the room with flag color guard leading the entourage. Finally prison for those who fail to salute flag pin on the emperor's jacket depicted on the obligatory 20x20 foot portraits that will be installed at every major gathering place in America
Excellent point. I'm flabbergasted how he appeals to so many people.

"Free Speech", to state the obvious, is about extremes--flag burning or mannequin burning.

There is nothing more "hateful" to many American citizens than burning the American flag, which, for them, makes it "a hate crime" per se, i.e., point of view is "free speech".

At the same time, there was nothing "unspecified"--the story is about America not some anti-democratic place like a Middle East nation run by king, cleric, or autocrat. Not sure they have "public squares" with such freedom of speech--though, I could be wrong.

From now on, for the sake of my mental health, I am going to ignore any more stories about outrageous Trump tweets.  I am beyond tired of the constant drama and the predictable Pavlovian media response of top-of-the-news stories repeating and then refuting Trump's ridiculous assertions.  I don't care that it is the President-elect saying all these stupid things.  The endless drama is exhausting (and Trump is not even in office yet) and detracts from the important issues. Trump has turned the media into a joke.  If you feel compelled to report every stupid Trump tweet, must it be the lead story???  Get a grip.

All of Trump's choices seem to indicate the Republican party elite is "Suggesting" candidates for positions.

Choosing Mnuchin will certainly highlight his experience with Goldman Sacks, America, as he routes the wealth of middle class Americans over to the wealthy personified by him as tax breaks.

I take curious note of the fact that the Television man Trump chose a Hollywood Financier to head the Treasury. Like I wrote before; Americans are enslaved by Television and movies, both of which promote guns resulting in the national fetish with guns and many killings.

Choosing a General Petraeus as a Secretary of State is a prelude to war as you can imagine he would accentuate military cooperation among allies.

Choosing Price as his HHS secretary and his disrespect for women is indicative of similar attitudes by Trump. Don Trump has never had a problem getting medical care and additionally, the Republican's are the party of death that believe in survival of the fittest unlike Christianity that was duped into voting for Republicans.

This all looks very incestuous and out of Trump's hands. Perhaps this is all payback for RNC support that got Trump elected.

You will all be thoroughly duped for the next four to eight years by Television and Movies.
Like hires like.
On the other hand, Mnuchin's career path *is* downright Trumpian. Both were born on third base, and swear they hit a triple.

Trump made a campaign promise to restore Glass-Steagall, we'll see if Mnuchin comes out for it as well.

One things for sure: The past 16 years, the Bush/Cheney regime, along with Obama and Hillary were against restoring Glass-Steagall, they all protected Wall Street with it's over $250 trillion in toxic derivatives exposure, aka "financial weapons of mass destruction" as Warren Buffet calls them.

"Too big to fail and jail" has too much power over our economic and political system.
You trust any of his promises?
And you think that will happen with all the insiders and billionaires he's giving positions to?

Dope one trust any politician's promises?

How does that "you can keep your healthcare plan if you like it" promise working out?

Great idea red states - you took a chance on arsonist and ended up giving him a flamethrower.

You can kiss your hopes for a more populist government goodbye, along with sound money policy, low interest rates, medicare, social security, clean water and air, and just about everything else important to future generations.

You own this disaster-in-waiting. Remember that as your towns continue to shrivel up and your school vouchers send Junior out into the world with an even worse education.

This is on you. For crying out loud, when will you ever learn?

IJ Reilly,
It depends. Some of us go about our business as usual, believing we are a bunch of fools, remembering a popular French poser when we were ten: what is the difference between an American chewing gum and a cow ruminating the cud? At times, a glint of light is to be seen in the bovine's eye'.
I think he means the whining left.

Rational people tend to respond this way to ignorance, childishness  and stupidity leading to national damage IJReilly.  Part of being "worked up" is to realize how the system works which allows us to gauge the "consequences" of a given action.  If the consequences don't square with claims we have a problem.  For example, I say I  will help the forgotten workers of America but my appointments result in typically GOP tax cuts for rich people. Tax cuts for rich people will not bring the coal jobs back or prevent automation. I could go on but this should get the point across.  Vote as you eat: unless you are in the 1% do not assume that voting for billionaires will help the working or middle classes.  America was "Great" in the 50s and 60s because cold war competition with Communism resulted in policies promoting a middle class.  Voting for Reagan and his successors has not  recreated the Truman to LBJ boom years.
Obamas only prior experience was as a US Senator for a few minutes. He was worse. An academic who didn't live in the real world.

This article leaves us the teaching of a lifestyle totally different from how an individual who is in the society with very few economic resources manages to enter a university in the united states in spite of all the remaining repulsion had the privilege of joining that Great merit since no member of his family had come so far with the few resources they had.

Despite this, it exposes itself to the great social impact of large families with a great portability economy, which stops that great gap between the poor and rich people but does not give any good cause and that by its performance many of the people who are in The poverty goes Forward With his education his great wisdom leads to being great and there are things that never thought they would get. We do not have to have much to achieve great changes in our lives we have to make our resources granted.

Realizing that fulfilling campaign promises to perform mouth-to-mouth resuscitation on the moribund coal industry -- the buggy whip of the energy world -- cannot work, Donald Trump has an original idea. Citing executive privilege, which the president-elect believes allows him to do anything he wants, Trump announced Project Snorting Dragon. West Virginia, Kentucky and Pennsylvania will be "removed" from the United States, and their citizens sent to China to re-engage with the coal business. The "blank" spaces remaining will be renamed Trumpalachia, and turned into golf resorts.
Do miners really miss the grime, danger, and black lung disease of coal mining?

I drove into ALABAMA in 1969, from Memphis TN via Tupelo MS, on US 78 (no Interstate there then).  When I crossed the state line, the welcome sign said I was on the George C. Wallace White Way.  I didn't feel particularly welcome.
Coal jobs were mostly automated in the last 30 years. They're not coming back. Trump lies about everything. Deal with it..

At the risk of being crass I suggest you do the right thing and renounce your citizenship.  In visiting Denmark recently I was most impressed by a T shirt that read "the answer is yes."  I have no idea exactly what it meant but it seems that anything goes in Denmark so if that appeals to you and that country will accept you permanently please stay.  We will then have one less liberal voter in the US.
A lot of presumed American talent is actually Canadian.

Reader in DC, who should believe it is the intent of Trump Inc. to surrender the take backs from Europe to the common folk of America? You must be one of the 0.01% insiders anxious for more money. It is indeed time to drain the swamp.
